name: Menu Obfuscator
author: Jose da Silva

sections.description: This plugin helps you to hide menu’s or submenu’s, for WordPress Admin, on a specific user. You’ll be able to hide individual items from a specific user in order to make a more clean interface.
sections.installation:
This section describes how to install the plugin and get it working.

e.g.

  1. Upload menu-obsfucator to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. You’ll be presented with a new link under the Settings menu named “Menu Obfuscator”
sections.changelog:
1.0

  • Fixing problem with version 0.9

0.9

  • Major code and visual refactor

0.3

  • Added extra validations to remove several warnings

0.2

  • First version of the plugin

description: This plugin helps you to hide menu’s or submenu’s, for WordPress Admin, on a specific user. You’ll be able to hide individual items from a specific user in order to make a more clean interface.
